DOCNAME: CASE OF BARBERÀ, MESSEGUÉ AND JABARDO v. SPAIN (ARTICLE 50)
CONCLUSION: Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The case was referred to the ORG by ORG ( " the Commission " ) and by ORG ( " the Government " ) on DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively , within the DATE period laid down by Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL and LAW ( article DATE , article CARDINAL ) of ORG ( " the Convention " ) . It originated in CARDINAL applications ( nos . CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) against GPE lodged with the Commission under LAW ( article CARDINAL ) by CARDINAL NORP nationals , Mr ORG , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG In a judgment of DATE ( " the principal judgment " ) , the ORG found a violation of LAW para . CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL ) of the LAW . In view of the belated transfer of the applicants from GPE to GPE to face trial , the unexpected change in the court ’s membership immediately before the beginning of the trial , the brevity of the trial and , above all , the fact that very important pieces of evidence were not adequately adduced and discussed at the trial in the applicants’ presence and in public , the proceedings in question , taken as a whole , did not satisfy the requirements of a fair and public hearing ( Series A no . CARDINAL , pp . CARDINAL - CARDINAL , paras . CARDINAL , and point CARDINAL of the operative provisions ) .

CARDINAL . ORG As the issue of the award of just satisfaction was not yet ready for decision , the ORG , in the principal judgment , reserved the whole of this question . It invited the ORG and the applicants to submit to it in writing , within DATE of the delivery of the judgment , their observations on the matter and in particular to inform it of any agreement reached between them ( ibid . , pp . CARDINAL - CARDINAL , paras . CARDINAL and point CARDINAL of the operative provisions ) .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , the ORG filed a memorial in which they replied to the claims that the applicants had lodged in DATE ( ibid . , p. CARDINAL , para . CARDINAL ) and drew attention , inter alia , to the fact that under NORP law , as it then stood , the proceedings could not be reopened and restitutio in integrum was impossible .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicants informed the PERSON that , on DATE , they had lodged an application with the Audiencia Nacional to have the judgment of that court of DATE set aside . They accordingly requested the ORG to stay the proceedings concerning the application of LAW ) until the national court had given judgment . On DATE they submitted observations in reply to the ORG ’s memorial .

On DATE , after consulting the Agent of the Government and ORG , the President agreed to stay the proceedings . On several occasions he renewed this decision pending the outcome of the various proceedings brought in GPE with a view to having the judgment of DATE set aside . On DATE the applicants requested that the GPE proceedings be resumed as ORG had quashed their convictions . On DATE the President requested the Agent of the Government for information on the progress of the domestic proceedings . In the light of that information , on DATE the ORG decided to resume its examination of the question within DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG The domestic proceedings conducted subsequent to the principal judgment included the following decisions :

( a ) on DATE the Audiencia Nacional decided to transmit the file to ORG after having found that it lacked jurisdiction . It ordered a stay of execution of the sentences imposed on the applicants by the judgment of DATE and their immediate release ;
( b ) on DATE the Audiencia Nacional decided to attach conditions to the applicants’ release , namely an obligation to report to a judge twice a month and a prohibition on leaving NORP territory ;
( c ) on DATE ORG gave a judgment dismissing the applicants’ application to have the original judgment set aside and revoking the stay of execution of their sentences ;
( d ) on DATE the Audiencia Nacional ordered that they be returned to prison ;

( e ) on DATE the ORG gave a judgment staying the execution of ORG judgment of DATE . It ordered that the applicants be released subject to the conditions laid down in the Audiencia Nacional ’s decision ;

( f ) on DATE ORG set aside the judgment of ORG and allowed the applicants’ application of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . It ordered the reopening of the trial in the Audiencia Nacional ;
( g ) on DATE , in a judgment which has become final , the Audiencia Nacional acquitted the applicants , finding that there was insufficient evidence .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the President requested the applicants to submit a memorial summarising and updating their claims for just satisfaction . The Registrar received this memorial on DATE and the Government ’s observations in relation thereto on DATE . On CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE respectively the applicants filed additional observations and the Delegate of the Commission lodged his comments .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the ORG decided that , in the circumstances of the case , it was not necessary to hold a hearing .
